intro: Anerincleistus pubinervosus, commonly known as the hairy-veined antheric. It is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America, characterized by its distinctive hairy veins on the leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a soft, pubescent texture. Anerincleistus pubinervosus is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
